result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Lee Sias Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges.  To be paid from 25% of prison funds.  Balance paid during Extended Supervision. Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
  All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim or her family during Initial Confinement or Extended Supervision.
No contact with firearms or dangerous weapons.
Batterers Interventin program or a course in anger management.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide sample.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised defendant:  due to DV conviction under Federal law the Defendant is prohibited from firearm possession; and due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Lee Sias Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 06-04-2015 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.
Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Joann M  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26208518 in court 1x on 5/26/15.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Demone M processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26208517 in court 1x on 5/26/15.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Cynthia W processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26208516 in court 1x on 5/26/15.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 18 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 74 DAYS time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 12 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-No contact with victim or her family during initial confinement or extended supervision.
-Obtain/maintain employment or SSI/SSDI.
-No contact with firearms or dangerous weapons.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Received & Filed, Letters on behalf of the victim.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Received & Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, and Notice & Acknowledgement of Voter Ineligibility. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Witness fee request prepared for Joann M., Demone M. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court, in custody, with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Kristin M. Schrank for Nicholas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.    Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with C.W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tyrone Lee Sias in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
